: is there any way of getting the local network ip ?
: I want to assign it to something like $ip
ah, abe3k don't know, use grep and awk on ifconfig to echo network ip if there is no direcht command for it
: so I have to make a scrip to filter the output of ifconfig then ?
ifconfig | grep "inet addr:192" | awk '{print $2}'
: awesome, I'll give it a try thanks
does that work for you? if you want the addr: part gone then pipe to sed also
: it worked verry well but I don't want to include the addr: in the output
hang on, let me try
: thanks buddy
ifconfig | grep "inet addr:192" | awk '{print $2}' | sed 's/addr://'
